alert.note: Alert for Madison (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 10:10AM CDT until March 26 at 12:37PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Missouri, including the following counties, Iron, Madison, Reynolds, Saint Francois and Sainte Genevieve. * WHEN...Until 700 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1007 AM CDT, MODOT reported closed roads in the warned area due to earlier heavy rain and thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible this afternoon and evening in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Farmington, Fredericktown, Ironton, Park Hills, Reynolds, Ellington, Pilot Knob, Iron Mountain Lake, Viburnum, Arcadia, St. Mary, Annapolis, Junction City, Cobalt, Marquand, Glover, Roselle, Iron Mountain, Belleview and Saco.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
